info.title: FRED API
info.description: API for accessing economic data from the Federal Reserve Economic Data (FRED) database.

get.summary: Get the child categories for a specified parent category.
Get related categories for a specified category.
Retrieve series within a specified category.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return
Offset for the start of the results

get.summary: Retrieve tags for a specific category.

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return
Offset for the start of the results

get.summary: Retrieve related tags for a specific category.

schema.description: Names of tags to find related tags for
Maximum number of results to return
Offset for the start of the results

get.summary: Get all releases of economic data.

schema.description: The maximum number of results to return
The offset for the start of results

200.description: A list of all economic data releases

get.summary: Retrieve release dates for all economic data.

schema.description: The maximum number of results to return
The offset for the start of results
Only include releases that have been updated since this time.

200.description: A list of release dates for economic data

get.summary: Get information for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID for the release of interest.

200.description: Detailed information about the specified release

get.summary: Retrieve release dates for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release whose dates are being queried.

200.description: Release dates for the specified economic data release

get.summary: Get series for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release whose series are being queried.
The maximum number of results to return.
The offset for the start of results.

200.description: A list of related tags for the specified economic data release

get.summary: Get sources for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release whose sources are being queried.

200.description: A list of sources for the specified economic data release

get.summary: Get tags for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release whose tags are being queried.
The maximum number of results to return.
The offset for the start of results.
A keyword or phrase to search for within the tag names.

200.description: A list of tags for the specified economic data release

get.summary: Retrieve related tags for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release for which related tags are being queried.
Names of tags to find related tags for.
The maximum number of results to return.
The offset for the start of results.

200.description: A list of related tags for the specified economic data release

get.summary: Get data tables for a specific economic data release.

schema.description: The unique ID of the release for which tables are being queried.
The unique ID of the element for which tables are being queried.
Boolean to include observations in the table.
The date of the observation to include in the table.

200.description: Data tables for the specified economic data release

parameters.name: Description:
parameters.description: Get an economic data series.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Read API Keys for more information.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: A key or file extension that indicates the type of file to send.

parameters.name: series_id
parameters.description: The id for a series.

parameters.name: realtime_start
parameters.description: The start of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: realtime_end
parameters.description: The end of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Get the observations or data values for an economic data series.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Read API Keys for more information.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: A key or file extension that indicates the type of file to send.

parameters.name: series_id
parameters.description: The id for a series.

parameters.name: realtime_start
parameters.description: The start of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: realtime_end
parameters.description: The end of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: non-negative integer, optional, default: 0

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results is ascending or descending observation_date order.

parameters.name: observation_start
parameters.description: The start of the observation period.

parameters.name: observation_end
parameters.description: The end of the observation period.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: A key that indicates a data value transformation.

parameters.name: frequency
parameters.description: An optional parameter that indicates a lower frequency to aggregate values to. The FRED frequency aggregation feature converts higher frequency data series into lower frequency data series (e.g. converts a monthly data series into an annual data series). In FRED, the highest frequency data is daily, and the lowest frequency data is annual. There are 3 aggregation methods available- average, sum, and end of period. See the aggregation_method parameter.

parameters.name: aggregation_method
parameters.description: A key that indicates the aggregation method used for frequency aggregation. This parameter has no affect if the frequency parameter is not set.

parameters.name: output_type
parameters.description: An integer that indicates an output type.

parameters.name: vintage_dates
parameters.description: Vintage dates are used to download data as it existed on these specified dates in history. Vintage dates can be specified instead of a real-time period using realtime_start and realtime_end.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Get the observations or data values for an economic data series.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Read API Keys for more information.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: A key or file extension that indicates the type of file to send.

parameters.name: series_id
parameters.description: The id for a series.

parameters.name: realtime_start

parameters.name: realtime_end

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Get the observations or data values for an economic data series.

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Read API Keys for more information.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: A key or file extension that indicates the type of file to send.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: The words to match against economic data series.

parameters.name: search_type
parameters.description: Determines the type of search to perform.

parameters.name: realtime_start
parameters.description: The start of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: realtime_end
parameters.description: The end of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: non-negative integer, optional, default: 0

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results is ascending or descending observation_date order.

parameters.name: filter_variable
parameters.description: The attribute to filter results by.

parameters.name: filter_value
parameters.description: The value of the filter_variable attribute to filter results by.

parameters.name: tag_names
parameters.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match all of.

parameters.name: exclude_tag_names
parameters.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names that series match none of.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: Get FRED tags. Optionally, filter results by tag name, tag group, or search. FRED tags are attributes assigned to series. See the related request fred/related_tags

parameters.name: api_key
parameters.description: Read API Keys for more information.

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: A key or file extension that indicates the type of file to send.

parameters.name: realtime_start
parameters.description: The start of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: realtime_end
parameters.description: The end of the real-time period. For more information, see Real-Time Periods.

parameters.name: tag_names
parameters.description: A semicolon delimited list of tag names to only include in the response. See the related request fred/related_tags.

parameters.name: tag_group_id
parameters.description: A tag group id to filter tags by type.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: The words to find matching tags with.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: non-negative integer, optional, default: 0

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Order results by values of the specified attribute.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: Sort results is ascending or descending order for attribute values specified by order_by.
